column4: what is the difference between xubuntu and ubuntu? is there anyway to load another kernel?
The difference between xubuntu and ubuntu is the user interface/desktop environment.
What OS are you running now?
I don't know your experience level, so let me know if I need to clarify stuff
If your computer is a car, the kernel is the software's "engine"
If you have a list of kernels available to you in grub, choose the oldest. See if there are some that have -pae at the end of the name and others that don't.
Most likely it has the same kernel as normal Ubuntu12
ok. I'm doing some googling for you real fast.
scroll most of the way down
I hope it works. It looks like it will from the research I did
the only difference is that the installer is text-mode for alternate.
the normal liveCD puts you in a graphical environment
yeah. Not a big deal - it's just not "pretty" when it's in the installer
